User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the Deen Journey app.

emailVerified.description: Indicates whether the user's email address has been verified.

age.description: User's age. Used to determine appropriate content and guidance.

preferredLanguage.description: User's preferred language for AI interaction (Deen Buddy).

deenDifficulty.description: User's selected difficulty level for Deen content.

salahDifficulty.description: User's selected difficulty level for Salah content.

surahDifficulty.description: User's selected difficulty level for Surah content.

definition.description: Stores user data. Includes 'emailVerified' for feature access control.  Path-based ownership for simple security rules.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user, corresponding to their Firebase Auth UID.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes security, scalability, and debuggability based on the core design principles. User data is stored in a path-based structure `/users/{userId}` for simple ownership rules. The user document includes `emailVerified` field to control access to certain features based on email verification status.

Authorization Independence is achieved by storing all necessary authorization data directly within the user document, avoiding the need for `get()` calls in security rules.

QAPs are supported through structural segregation, ensuring that all documents within the `/users/{userId}` collection share the same security requirements. This prevents the need for complex filtering within rules.
